channel.title: Installation on CRIB artemis
channel.description: Recent content in Installation on CRIB artemis

item.title: Requirements
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa The following machines have been tested for operation.

item.title: cmake
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa Generally, dnf install cmake or brew install cmake support latest version of the cmake, but for some older machine like CentOS7, it is too old to install ROOT.

item.title: ROOT
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa Artemis uses ROOT library.

item.title: yaml-cpp
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa Info The yaml-cpp can be installed by some package manager like apt or dnf, but I’m not sure it will work or not in the installation of the artemis.

item.title: artemis
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa From the current situation, CRIB experiment doesn’t use GET system, so we describe how to install it without linking it to GET decoder.

item.title: mount setting
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-02 by Kodai Okawa For the convinience, we use one directory to store raw data (ridf files) and make symbolic link to each user work directory.

item.title: energyloss calculator
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-05 by Kodai Okawa Some CRIB-specific files use energy loss libraries.

item.title: art_analysis
item.description: last modified: 2023-11-14 by Kodai Okawa With this command, all initial settings of “art_analysis” are made.
